etymologies: Middle English: from Old French ton, from Latin tonus, from Greek tonos ‘tension, tone’, from teinein ‘to stretch’

definitions: a musical or vocal sound with reference to its pitch, quality, and strength

examples.text: the piano tone appears monochrome or lacking in warmth

shortDefinitions: musical or vocal sound of its pitch and strength

definitions: a modulation of the voice expressing a particular feeling or mood
shortDefinitions: modulation of voice expressing particular feeling or mood

definitions: a musical note, warble, or other sound used as a particular signal on a telephone or answering machine.
shortDefinitions: musical note or other sound used as signal

definitions: the general character or attitude of a place, piece of writing, situation, etc.

examples.text: my friend and I lowered the tone with our oafish ways
there was a general tone of ill-concealed glee in the reporting

shortDefinitions: general character or attitude of place, piece of writing

definitions: an atmosphere of respectability or class

examples.text: they don't feel he gives the place tone

definitions: a basic interval in classical Western music, equal to two semitones and separating, for example, the first and second notes of an ordinary scale (such as C and D, or E and F sharp); a major second or whole step

examples.text: the B flat clarinet's part is written one tone higher than the pitch required

shortDefinitions: basic interval in classical Western music, equal to two semitones and separating

definitions: the particular quality of brightness, deepness, or hue of a tint or shade of a color

examples.text: stained glass in vivid tones of red and blue
an attractive color that is even in tone and texture

definitions: the general effect of color or of light and shade in a picture.
shortDefinitions: general effect of colour or of light and shade in picture

definitions: a slight degree of difference in the intensity of a color.
shortDefinitions: slight degree of difference in intensity of colour

definitions: (in some languages, such as Chinese) a particular pitch pattern on a syllable used to make semantic distinctions.
shortDefinitions: (in some languages, such as Chinese) particular pitch pattern on syllable used to make semantic distinctions

definitions: (in some languages, such as English) intonation on a word or phrase used to add functional meaning.
shortDefinitions: (in some languages, such as English) intonation on word or phrase used to add functional meaning

definitions: the normal level of firmness or slight contraction in a resting muscle

examples.text: a certain amount of daily exercise is essential to maintain proper body tone and function

shortDefinitions: normal level of firmness or slight contraction in resting muscle

definitions: the normal level of activity in a nerve fiber
shortDefinitions: normal level of activity in nerve fibre

definitions: give greater strength or firmness to (the body or a muscle)
shortDefinitions: give greater strength or firmness to

definitions: give (a monochrome picture) an altered color in finishing by means of a chemical solution

examples.text: it's a good idea to sepia tone the whole print first

shortDefinitions: give monochrome picture altered colour in finishing by means of chemical solution
